intro: Podonephelium deplanchei, commonly known as the Desert Daisy, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It is characterized by its compact, low-growing habit and produces showy, daisy-like yellow flowers. The plant has hairy, blue-green leaves that help reduce water loss in its harsh environment. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure. Podonephelium deplanchei is often used in xeriscaping due to its drought tolerance and ornamental value.
